critique: The executive order seems to be a formal declaration about land withdrawal for flood control. It doesn't seem to explicitly aim to evoke any strong emotions. However, one could argue it subtly aims to inspire a sense of reassurance (joy) that the government is taking action to prevent floods and provide unemployment relief. There might also be a very mild sense of surprise that such an order is being issued. The other emotions (sadness, anger, fear, disgust) don't seem to be relevant.
